headline: Sweet and Sour Meatballs
description: Sweet and sour meatballs made with ground beef are simmered in a deliciously thick sweet-sour sauce. Serve over rice for a quick and easy dinner!

video.name: How to Make Sweet and Sour Meatballs

name: Sweet and Sour Meatballs

recipeInstructions.text: Make meatballs: Mix beef, bread crumbs, onion, egg, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl until well combined.
Cook meatballs in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until evenly browned and cooked through.
Make sauce: Mix brown sugar, water, ketchup, vinegar, soy sauce, and cornstarch together in a medium bowl until smooth.
Pour sauce over meatballs. Reduce heat to low and simmer until sauce is thick, 3 to 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Definitely a great quick dinner for me and my boys. I used white vinegar and it worked splendidly. I also left out the onions as i have an allergy, but it turned out just fine without them. The sauce reminds me of the sweet and sour sauce from Panda Express!! Overall, i really enjoyed making this and eating it!!
Made the sauce keto and it was the best!

Its ok, No problem making it. Tasted good. I put a lot of Italian seasons in meat balls. Far as cooking them, if they are to mushy, then they won’t cook in a round formation. (Sean). Also if you make them and put them in fridge so they are firm then just bake them in the oven and then turn the once.
New family favorite

I had frozen meatballs so I was just looking for a sauce. This one is excellent. I cut back on the brown sugar just a bit cuz we don't like really sweet. Was leary about using the apple cider vinegar, I didn't have cider so I used white vinegar. It was delicious.

Absolutely delicious. Highly recommended. One batch on rice with steamed veg fed 3 people and had an extra portion left for leftovers. Prep time was much longer than 5 minutes but not an issue at all.
Used apple cider vinegar, which was a bit overpowering. I ended up using more sugar to compensate.
Loved it. I followed the recipe exactly and I used apple cider vinegar. Very happy and will definitely be making these again!

It's really hard to cook rounded meatballs evenly on a skillet, leaving some parts pink and some parts too browned. Balls fell apart easily after moving constantly trying to get them to cook on all sides, leading to a sweet and sour meatball mush.
Fantastic meatballs, I am the designated meatball person for all our family gatherings. Great recipe.

I was looking for something a bit more Asian, but after some tweaks (added ginger and replaced catsup with cocktail sauce), it was good. I had no problem with the apple cider vinegar, but I like it on the sour side.

Tangy, interesting.
I used apple cider vinegar, by accident. 
Had to add extra cornstarch mixture to get it to thicken.
 2/3 of us disliked it, 1/3 of us LOVED it. Mixed in some oven roasted peppers and onion and served it over basmati.

I used premade Italian meatballs, but used the sauce exactly as directed with apple cider vinegar. I did cut up some red peppers too and added them. I let it simmer for a few minutes and it was a hit with everyone in my house.

I made it for myself and my partner, he absolutely loves sour bases, so using two cups of apple cider vinegar was not a huge deal, I just counteracted the effects with sugar and baking soda. Great with ground saussage
Great taste, but didn’t make enough for my husband and I at the base size recipe

Im sure I didnt have a pound (little less) of hamburger, but i still used the recipe. Was a little scared that the one egg wasnt enough, but the meatball still held and cooked pretty good. I didnt have a cider vinegar, so I started off with 1/3 cup of white vinegar and followed other instructions to follow the sauce. I just did a taste test of the sauce if it needed more vinegar, which I added a little bit of it each time until I liked the sauce taste. It was wonderful meal, will definitely use the recipe next time.
My husband can’t get enough of these! So good!

I made a triple batch. I used white vinegar 1 tbsp/ batch I added 1 extra vinegar and 2 extra tbsp of Soya sauce. It was fantastic. 
Served with rice and Brussels sprouts . My kids devoured it.
This is a good recipe. I have a family member that is allergic to eggs so I used greek yogurt in the meatballs. This one is easy to adjust for more or fewer servings also.
It was delicious!

Great Recipe, Great Flavors! Both of my kids loved it! One modification I will make for next time is to moisten the bread crumbs with 1-2 TB warm water before adding into the other ingredients. It makes it easier to mix the meatballs and makes them a little more moist. Also, make sure the onion is extremely finely chopped!

Love it! I never eat meatballs but made these for family. Everyone loved them so I tried one and it was amazing. I used apple cider vinegar because that's all I had and it didn't stink or taste bad to us.

If you are interested in having vinegar meatballs then this is the recipe for you. I even tried to fix it by adding more sugar & ketchup to the VINEGAR SAUCE - this did not help at all. Maybe 1 tea spoon instead of 1/2 a cup would have done the trick. If I could rate this 0 stars I would.

3 stars only because I changed a lot of the recipe based on reviews and it’s not even close to the original. But with the changes I made it turned out beautiful and my two young kids and husband devoured the whole pan when I was hoping for leftovers, you know it’s great when your 2yro eats 10 meatballs!. Great base recipe to work off of and adjust to your tastes. Thanks for sharing!

I used Bragg apple cider vinegar, it was very good, not ruined as someone else suggested. Maybe I’ll try white wine vinegar next time. I topped it with scallion greens and orange peel to jazz up the plate. Agree that the meatball part could use more pizazz, maybe seasoned breadcrumbs and few tablespoons of siracha.
These were good. Cut back the sugar a bit, white vinegar 1/4 cup, added some garlic powder. Will make again.
Followed the recipe but use frozen meat balls. Came out so so, sauce is great but next time it will be homemade meatballs!
Easy to make and very yummy

The other reviewers made me nervous about using apple cider vinegar so I used 1/2 apple cider and 1/2 distilled white. I also substituted Murphs Bloody Mary Mix for half of the ketchup. This recipe was truly AMAZING.
Kids loved them asked if we could eat them everyday.
An awesome easy delicious meal!

Delicious, now if I can figure out how to take a picture!! New favourite, and I used apple cider vinegar with mother, I added a taste of siracha and a taste of Frank's hot pepper sauce, those are the only changes I made, over rice and a salad on the side. Thank you so very much, really enjoyed making these!!
I'm not one to order sweet and sour foods but this one knocked my socks off. Hubby loved this. Not overly sweet and just a bit of tang. I will be making this for company!
I followed this exactly and the sauce was more watery than pictured. hubby still ate it and said the flavor is good but consistency left something to be desired.

this was far from the first time I've made this recipe and I love it every single time! I don't eat beef or pork so I make it with ground chicken or turkey instead. I didn't adjust a single thing when making it this time except for being a little short on cider vinegar so I topped it off with white vinegar. I couldn't tell the difference
So excited I found this recipe that reminds me of my Moms sweet and sour meatballs. My husband loves them, and a big hit at potlucks
Yum!! I added a can of pineapple too!
I didn't make the meatballs but used the sauce recipe...everyone raved about them!!! Very simple and you have everything you need in your pantry :)
I didn't make the meatballs but used the sauce recipe...everyone raved about them!!! Very simple and you have everything you need in your pantry :)
I tried making this recipe exactly as posted but could not get over the cider vinegar taste, as it was very strong. If I make this again I will most likely half the amount of vinegar in this recipe.

Great recipe!!
Soo delicious 
Love the sweet/sour contrast
Found this recipe about a year ago. It's a HIT!!! my family loves it and I now make it often. I use ground turkey or chicken sometimes and cut back on the sugar. Either way is yummy!
Amazing! This recipe is to drool for!

I have made this several times now...and only begrudgingly give it 4stars because I did add/make a few changes. I add peppers and onions to the sauce and then put everything in the slow cooker on lows for a few hours and let the flovours develop. The men in the house request this one often. Thanks for sharing a great recipe.
Easy recipe but the Meatballs and sauce came out tasting too bland for my taste. May experiment with in the future.
very good, used apple cider vinegar....

Amazing recipe. I used lean ground turkey meat and no egg or bread crumbs. I’m gluten sensitive. Froze the meatballs for a bit before browning them. Added a touch of pepper. It turned out fantastic. Served over plain brown rice.
I used onion and garlic powder instead of chopped onion. Also used a mix of white and red wine vinegar at half the recommended volume. Oh, and moose meat... mmmmmmooose...

These were a big hit as a Thanksgiving appetizer! Everyone loved them. I tripled the recipe and they still disappeared! I also used cider vinegar for one batch and regular white vinegar for another. The regular vinegar was much better. I baked the meatballs at 350 for 20 minutes. I brought the sauce to a boil on medium-high heat then reduced the heat until it was the desired thickness. They turned out great.
My 5yr old daughter normally doesn't eat meatballs; not even in spaghetti... but she loved this! I suggest doubling the batch with growing children, haha!
I loved it and most importantly my husband did love it as well. Thank you for sharing, now is in my favorite recipes. Perfect if you have guests.
A tip: I always find that just ground beef can have a tendency of being too dry. I use equal parts ground beef, pork and veal. Trust me you will never have a dry meatball again!
Very good. Does not need an extra half an hour though. Whole dish was ready in 20-30 min. Delicious!
Hmmmhmmmmm it turned out awesome yummmmm

3.5 star as is. 5 star with half the sugar and an extra dash of soy sauce. I also added 2 dashes of war sauce to the meatball mix with fresh chopped parsley. Served with plain white rice and steamed asparagus...will make again with these changes.

excellent sauce-- it would be good w/ chicken or pork. I used frozen meatballs -- I also put a can of chunk pineapple w/ juice , chopped onion red pepper, sliced carrots serve over jasmine rice --- I did use rice vinegar and only had 1/4 cup and rest cider - I think white vinegar be milder - I had to put some extra sugar -- just a tad w/ vinegar taste but don't leave out - you need it - I use only 1/4 c. ketchup but I will be making this sauce again - delicious homemade sweet and sour base sauce
A good sweet and sour. Not outstanding, but a nice sauce for an appetizer meatball.

This was a really good dish with bold flavors. I followed other reviews and halved the amount of vinegar (used white vinegar), added a can of pineapple tidbits with the juice and some Mrs. Dash onion and herb spice. Overall I was very happy with the dish and will be making it again.

Yummy! I line baking sheets with parchment paper and bake them all at once.....usually for about 12 minutes. Be careful not to overbake - makes them dry. Then put them in the sauce in the slow cooker on low for a few hours.

Easy to make and my family, which includes teens... loved this recipe. The only change is that I added dried parsley, garlic powder and dried oregano to the plain breadcrumbs before mixing into ground beef. I also used regular distilled white vinegar in place of the cider vinegar. The sauce was so good and I'm thinking about using it for chicken too. This recipe is definitely a keeper.
Absolutely delish and easy to make..
Followed the recipe exactly. An easy family favourite! Delicious!

This recipe is really great. I ended up substituting the water with grape juice that I needed to use up and it made the sauce too sweet--I should have cut back on the sugar. I also added a bit of mustard and a few spices to the meatballs. Overall, easy and yummy!

I normally don't like ketchup based sauces but this was pretty good. I only had white vinegar and adjusted the amount based on other reviews. I started with 1 TBSP as per one suggestion but was too weak so I added about 3 TBSP in total and was delish!
No changes, it turned out great. Have it with a side of rice. Will make it again definitely.
The cider vinegar overwhelms it a bit. I think i would reduce it a bit or do 1/2 white vinegar and 1/2 cider. 1/4 cup each.
Baked in the oven in a casseroke dish in the oven at 259 degrees instead of frying in a pan. Sauce is amazing
My kids have said this is the best one they have had. And they are REALLY hard to please!
I used apple cider vinegar and it turned out great. Will be making this many times again.
Delicious recipe and will probably make it again. I added cooked broccoli and pineapple to the sauce once it had thickened..
M'y Husband loved it and so did I.
I used half the amount of brown sugar and still very sweet. They were delicious!!

These meatballs and sauce were very good. I'll use the recipe again. I made the following changes. I used venison instead of beef, added 4 cloves of garlic minced, also a couple pinches of Chinese 5 spice seasoning for the meatballs. For the sauce I used garlic scape white vinegar instead of the vinegar listed. As for cooking I fried the meatballs in lard and after adding the sauce I cooked it til it was the thickness I liked - didn't time it at all. We had buttered noodles and applesauce to go with the meatballs and entire family was happy with meal.
This is my go-to recipe for sweet and sour meatballs. I make it exactly as written, cook them in an electric skillet, and serve over white rice. Absolutely delicious.
This recipe was really good. I would grate the onions not chop them. The onions were a bit big but I will make this recipe again.
Omg I love its now one of ny favourite dish!
i used blush wine, no cider on hand. Fantabulous. hubby loved them.

Its a sweet and sour sauce so it is going to be sweet and sour. I made it exactly according to the recipie other than adding some chopped red and yellow peppers and some shirachia. Did not find it had too much vinegar. Used the sauce over frozen meatballs which makes it a super fast dinner
Love this recipe. Its easy to make and my family loves it. I tend to not put as much vinegar in it though. With the recommended amount I think it tastes too much like vinegar.

Made just the sauce with packaged meatballs. I loved it and could not stop eating them. Made sauce in a sauce pan exactly as directed but with Apple cider vinegar( didn't know there was a difference between cider vinegar) and loved it. Great over rice!!! I will get to the meatballs eventually and I'm sure I'll add something to make them a bit more flavorful.

Excellent flavour. I've made these several times and sometimes make changes, although they are great as is. I usually add a grated carrot to the meatballs for extra nutrition, and have substituted green onions for regular onion. A family favorite!
Everyone loved these meatballs. I did add carrots and pineapple chunks that I had on hand and needed to use up. I will definitely be making this dish again and again!
I made these but IMO the recipe calls for too much breadcrumbs. My meatballs were falling apart and were also very bland.

Pretty good. I made a couple alterations to mine. Instead of water I used apple juice. cut the brown sugar down to 3/4 C. the first time I made it. the 2nd time I made it I still substituted the water with apple juice. However the 2nd time instead of brown sugar I used a small can of crushed pineapple and eyeballed in a couple tablespoons of old fashioned molasses. and I loved it the 2nd time. the deeper flavor of the molasses really added in another layer of flavor I think was missing.
I used 1/3 C APPLE CIDER VINEGAR & doubled the soy sauce & used 2/3 C sugar instead of a whole cup. Came out great, my picky kids say it's delicious.

Made this last night and made a couple changes.. Added only 1/8 cup brown sugar and about 3 tbsp of white vinegar (thats all I had on hand). My son enjoyed it, however I felt it was quite sweet and that it was missing something. For as simple and as easy as this recipe was I'd make it again but I'll definitely be tweaking it up.

Good basic sauce recipe. Add orange zest! It really makes a difference. I halved the sauce and it was plenty saucy for 6 servings with extra sauce to pour over rice. I used a quarter of the brown sugar (so if you make the full recipe, use half). If you use as much sugar as the recipe calls for, it'll taste like candy. I used apple cider vinegar and I quartered that as well (again, if you're making the full recipe, use half). You can always taste the sauce and add more sugar or vinegar but if it's too sweet or vinegary, you can't go back and the whole thing will be ruined. I made my own meatballs (just mixed half a pound of Italian sausage and half a pound of ground turkey) and lightly sauteed an onion, a red bell pepper and a yellow bell pepper. Overall, a good dish.

Just made this for Dinner with creamy mash an added cheese and ginger to the meatballs an was superb!, I'm not sure what cider vinegar is I'm in australia (corn starch is cornflour) so I presumed white vinegar would do, which it worked out great =). Definitely a good easy meatball dish

Sweet, tangy, sour deliciousness. I eyeball my ingredients and it always turns out delish. Mix the meat with some onions, salt n pepper, maybe some breadcrumbs or even some celery for that crunch texture...however you make it the sauce is perfect. Keep in mind not to make the meatballs too fancy or the sauce may not pair well. I only use the amount called for the cider vinegar and if I don't have that I use regular vinegar but not as much. I mix the sauce to my taste then thicken it with corn starch and water after pouring the sauce over the cooked meatballs. Love this recipe its soo good!! Simple and delicious!
I served this appetiser dish to my good friends last night and they raved about it and cleaned the dish out. That always makes a cook happy. It was very easy and quick to make.

This was delicious; not sure what type of cider vinegar I used as it was no longer in the original container. I prepared it according to recipe but after the first serving, I added a tsp. of red pepper flakes to my personal tastes. Yum!

Made this tonight and it was a hit! Loved the sauce, perfect balance! Used Apple cider vinegar and it was great (one reviewer said it wasn't the same as cider vinegar). I used my own meatball recipe and baked them in the oven to make it easier. Will definitely make again!
Really good

Love this recipe! Have made it many times for various occasions, it always goes over well. Rarely do we have leftovers. Much better than the kind made with jelly. Easy to prepare...although I do save time and use frozen meatballs. (just put the meatballs frozen in the mix, put the slower cooker on and stir occasionally). Turns out great everytime
Yummiest sweet and sour sauce !
Awesome! Doubled mine and just added 2 splashes of white vinegar. I also added 2 cloves of garlic then sauteed it with the onions and some dried oregano and dried basil.
Delicious sauce. I cut the sugar to 3/4c and it was perfect. I used my own meatballs.
For my first try on the sweet and sour meatballs I think I did pretty good, not as good as my gramma but better than some people ; )

This is a fantastic recipe and definitely has the taste I remember from my childhood. I did make a few changes the second time I made it: I added grated onion and some paprika, garlic powder, and pepper to the meatballs, cut down the sugar and vinegar by about 40% and threw in a tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce, a few dashes of hot pepper sauce and a teaspoon of molasses! So all in all it was a departure from the original recipe but I liked it better with the changes. My husband likes it with fries!
